page.title: 11Church,Bells,Choir.
page.content: The church of St.John the Baptist is in Church Lane.It was burnt down in the 1830's and re-built in 1835 at a cost of Â£5,000.The first church was made of wood but the new one is made of stone.The Victorian vicarage is now up for sale and a new vicarage is to be built on the Glebe Field.Our last vicar left in March 1985 and at the moment the parish has not got a vicar. The church tower has a fine clock which shows different times on each face.There are 4 bells in the tower which are rung by the Old Dalby and Nether Broughton ringers.The largest bell is the tenor which was cast in 1608 and weighs 9 tons.Four of the ringers are from our primary school. The choir has 9 members and practises every Friday evening.The girl choristers wear blue and the boys red and white gowns.
